I was reading an article on stem cell research today and didn't realize the full benefits this research could provide. 
 
 I don't understand what the hold up is on being able to use stem cells for research and rehabilitation? I know that it requires the stem cells taken from a fetus and that by doing this, destroys the fetus, but given that abortions are legal, why can't they just take the material from "donors" who are having abortions anyway? I would think that at least that life would not have been a total loss.

Frozen embryos could also be used and there are already plenty of them that will probably never be implanted. You don't have to abort a fetus to yield embryonic stem cells. The current ban on using embryonic stem cells for research purposes is narrow-minded to say the least.

What I fail to understand is why the anti-stem cell party isn't outraged at invitro-fertilization. Millions of polential humans are destroyed every year by this process. For every child that is born this way, thousands of fertilized eggs perish, eggs that could be used for stem cell research.

The reason for the hold up on this incredible new break through is because of the stiff shirts in the white house and congress. As long as Bush is president and the bible run's the united states and not the constitution, stem cell research will not pass. It is unfortunate but hopefully America will vote in a less stubborn redneck in 2008. There are things you can do to try to help as far as rally and sign any petitions that come your way. :)

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Stem Cell Research
